\subsection{Validation Tests}

The Centroid Test and Eclipsing Binary Discrimination Test are
chi-squared hypothesis tests. For these tests, a significance of 100\%
favors a planet, while 0\% indicates an unlikely planet.

\subsubsection{Weak Secondary Test}

\IfFileExists{weak-secondary-results-\csname planet\thislevelitem\endcsname}{%
  \begin{table}[htb!]
    \rowcolors{2}{\lightRowColor}{\darkRowColor}
    \begin{tabular}{l r r l r r}
      \toprule
      \textbf{Result}
      & \textbf{Value}
      & \textbf{Uncertainty}
      & \textbf{Units}
      & \textbf{Statistic in Sigmas}
      & \textbf{Significance (\%)}\\
      \midrule
      \input{weak-secondary-results-\csname planet\thislevelitem\endcsname}
      \bottomrule
    \end{tabular}
  \end{table}
}{%
  \texttt{No weak secondary test results available.}
}%
